poem:
### Red Ink

In cathedral spires of learning,  
ledger sheets lie bleeding;  
columns crumble, dreams turned  
debts, anonymous undergraduates  
owing futures to figures;  
a silent bell tolls profits lost,  
echoing through lecture halls—  
their halls, their halls, their halls.  
Imagine libraries drifting;  
a lent spell unbound, scriptless  
stars blinking operative.
